entry.title: SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT, Fort Albany
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 11:02 p.m. EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Tuesday night: A few clouds. Low minus 20.
entry.summary: A few clouds. Wind up to 15 km/h. Low minus 20. Wind chill minus 13 this evening and minus 27 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Chance of light snow. High minus 6. POP 70%
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud. 70 percent chance of light snow late in the afternoon. Wind becoming east 20 km/h gusting to 50 in the morning then increasing to 40 gusting to 60 late in the afternoon. High minus 6. Wind chill minus 30 in the morning and minus 14 in the afternoon. Risk of frostbite. UV index 4 or moderate. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday night: Ice pellets mixed with snow. Temperature steady near minus 5.
entry.summary: Snow changing to ice pellets or snow in the evening then to light snow overnight. Risk of freezing drizzle overnight. Wind east 40 km/h gusting to 60 diminishing to 20 before morning. Temperature steady near minus 5. Wind chill minus 15 in the evening and minus 9 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023
